intro: Valeriana bridgesii, commonly known as the New Zealand valerian, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often strongly scented leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its flowering period occurs in spring, producing clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Valeriana bridgesii is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used traditionally in Māori medicine for its calming properties.
